ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I'd tell them that I was most looking forward to this course, and am extremely disappointed. This is not a Yale quality course.
Would recommend except for the class timings.
It is actually to good course that I recommend.

I would summarise it as a course that offers a valuable and broad instruction in macroeconomics, but is "fast-and-dirty", in the sense that it touches upon relevant models for a broad range of issues without trying to go in-depth.I would recommend Economics 546 01 to any fellow student who is curious about the content of the discipline beyond the undergraduate level but doesn't want any special emphasis on certain topics.
No, I would not recommend this course.
I would recommend the course
Classes are too long

I would probably not recommend the course to a non-IDE student. This is because the lectures require a lot of effort and self-motivation and a lot of the time the topic can be learnt from reading the slides. Whilst I have learnt a lot from the course in the end, I think there are much better macro courses from my undergraduate experience at LSE and having spoken with undergraduates and PhD students at Yale.
Challenging and relevant course which provides ample exposure to macroeconomics. However, style of lesson is very static and dry.
Good coverage of interesting topics in Macroeconomics.Yes, recommended to students with or without foundation in Macroeconomics.
Yes I would recommend it, definitely. It is a good course and the regularity of homework ensures you are not left behind.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It did not
It was a helpful course.
I am thinking of picking some model from this course like RBC to do it in my dissertation.

As I stated earlier, the course gave a broad view of a variety of topics, the problem sets offered insight, and I enjoyed studying for it. It also exposed me to some of the modern, cutting edge methods of solving problems.
No
Did help deepen my knowledge of certain concepts and also spurred interest in new topics
Taught me okay
I learned a lot in this course.
a wide breadth of exposure to macroeconomics, a good start on major topics in macroeconomics.
Learnt topics that built well on the foundation I have in Macroeconomics as an Economics major in undergrad.
